title: Interregnum
report:
Welcome back to the Jart Report after a week eight highlighted by a devastating injury to the King (interregnum= time span between kings), and some surprising results. Despite the poor showing from The Family, we remain excited to bring you this week’s analysis.

Week Eight Recap

To start, we are going to be looking back at how week eight unfolded versus the predictions that the Jart Team put together. The team strives to learn from previous weeks to make the most informed predictions, and as we have moved into the middle of the season we hope to improve in accuracy considerably. We will go matchup by matchup and look at what we learned as the season begins to take shape.

Team ACL Tear vs Tompa Bay:

Prediction: Team ACL Tear by 17.8

Reality: Team ACL Tear by 9.26

“Glad to see that my boys can still get it done even with multiple goose eggs. A win is a win is a win” - Lopey

“Cardinals stack is goated” - Bank

Real Brothers vs NN:

Prediction: NN by 23.6

Reality: NN by 59.38

“Close week, glad we could scrap it out. Thanks to my opponent for a great matchup” - NN

“As head of The Family I did not feel we had much of a chance, and it is clear that the kids caught on this week. Was encouraged by the play of Hurts, Chase, and Tyreek, but obviously significant progress needs to be made. Kyle Pitts was not that ___ this week, but I still have a lot of faith in him. I feel great about my roster especially when all are healthy, but this week was certainly a sign that we’re not about to cruise the rest of the season. Props to NN” - Jart

GRIDDY GANG vs Team Ross:

Prediction: GRIDDY GANG by 17.4

Reality: Team Ross by 48.82

“Going into the week and glaring at team Griddy Gang I was nervous as his team on paper is top 3 and not 3 in the league. The doubters were of course out on my team but the fellas who we started with from day 1 showed up and showed glimpses of what I hoped for. We thank Jason for a light sweat of a week and wish him the best for his loss of King Henry. Look for us to engage in a trade this week.” - Alex

“My guys didn't perform plain and simple. All I can do is draft them/pick them up on waivers and put them in a position to succeed. Out of my hands at that point.” - Jason

United Nations vs Mike Williams WR1:

Prediction: Mike Williams WR1 by 7.8

Reality: Mike William WR1 by 4.78

“I have no words. I had a good run in this league.” - MW

“Patrick Mahomes is broken” - Brad

Can’t Keep Up With His Name Changes vs I Got a Half Chubb:

Prediction: $94 for Dwilli REAALLY? by 13.4

Reality: $94 for Dwilli REAALLY? by 5.96

“W” - Nooni

“Danny can suck my balls” - CJ

Dmichs vs Team Horses:

Prediction: Team Horses by 3.7

Reality: Team Horses by 0.36

“I’m gonna owe Daniel a few taquitos after that one” - Folbe

“Bad move on my part to choose Heinicke as Dak’s replacement. But what the f*** Kelce, c’mon.” - Dmichs

Biggest Movers: Jason down from 6 to 11

Transaction Analysis

In this segment we will look at the transactions from this week and rate the best and worst one in the opinion of the Jart Report. *This does not include trades*

Best Transaction: Pat Friermuth, $0, MW. We love that guy, Jase messed up

Honorable Mention: Evan Engram, MW, $0. Had his best night of the season on MNF (even though MW dropped him).

Worst Transaction: Bears D/ST, NN, $0. Not many bad transactions this week, but this defense got -6 against San Fran and plays Najee next week.

Honorable Mention: Kirk Cousins, Jase, $16. Gotta try, but I don’t like that.

Special Segment: Trade Jartalyzer

Calvin Ridley for MJJ is not worth my time. But it was humor.

Bank: A

Lopey: B

Record by PF Finish

1st: 8-0

6th: 4-4

Finish in 7th boys

  2. NN (4-4)

No debating.

Worst Possible Lineup

Here we will look at the worst combination of starters in this league!

QB: Kyler Murray, 9.06 points, JL

RB: David Johnson, 0.8 points, Jart

RB: James Robinson, 4.4 points, MW

WR: Robby Anderson, 0 points, Jase

WR: Russell Gage, 0 points, Bank

TE: Rob Gronkowski, 0 points, JL

FLEX: Emmanuel Sanders, 0 points, JL

D/ST: Tampa D/ST, -1 points, Bank

K: Chase McLaughlin, 2.5 points, Folbe

Total Points: 15.76

Would it have beaten Jason: No. Congrats to NN & Brad on not being the teams listed.

New Segment: Best Possible Lineup

QB: Josh Allen, 29.46 points, Folbe

RB: Michael Carter, 27.7 points, NN

RB: Joe “Bank’s Dad” Mixon, 23.1 points, JL

WR: AJ Brown, 26.5 points, Alex

WR: Chris Godwin, 24.0 points, Nooni

TE: TJ Hockenson, 13.9 points, Bank

FLEX: Amari Cooper, 22.2 points, Dmichs

D/ST: Philly D/ST, 20 points, JL

K: Nick Folk, 8 points, Brad

Total Points: 194.86 → will be a typical week for Nooni soon

Would it have beaten Dwitt in 2019: No. We suck boys.

League Takes

In this segment, we get to hear from all of you. They will be anonymous for the fun of it. The Jart Report team will be organizing them into three categories: Takes we agree with, takes we are neutral on, and takes we disagree with.

Agree:

-“Need a massive overhaul of implementation of league policies”

-“Rip to Jason’s season. Maybe next year”

-“I feel bad for Jason’s injury luck”

-“I’m not 12” - Nooni

-“You give me everything I want already jarty”

-“People are talking about BMW WR1.8 - not sure if it’s good things being said, but they’re definitely talking”

-“Can’t say I'm all that surprised Derrick Henry got hurt. I could draft Superman on my team and even he would find a way to tear an ACL”

-“Too much trade intervention going on in this league”

Neutral:

-“Hmu if you have streaming questions” (Lopey)

-“The league is very even this year”

-“The leagues top 3 teams are Jonah NN and Jart in that order”

-“My trading days have seemingly come to an end this year sadly. Everyone has sucked me dry and I have nothing left to give. Gotta ride with my studs the rest of the year. BOL to everyone but my phone lines are now shut off (I reserve the right to turn them back on)” - NN

Disagree:

-“Badussy Squirts is going to hershey squirt his way out of the playoffs”

-“I could have the first two rounds of picks in next years draft and still end up below .500”

Returning Segment: Jart’s Mailbag

Here we answer your questions! So please ask some in the future.

Who is the next top 10 player at their position to head to the IR?

Ignoring guys who are currently nursing some injuries and may easily reinjure them (Kyler, Waller, Knox, etc.), I am actually going to go with a former Family member here in Cordarelle Patterson. I really hope this is not the case as I still have him in my other five leagues, but the amount of touches he is getting at his age is a bit of a concern. He was lucky to avoid a concussion in London, and I wouldn’t be surprised if he gets hurt soon.

When is RIP DMONT coming back?

Good question Squeejadiddlydoo. The Bears have been very vague on his status, and I partly wondered if maybe he would get dealt to Tennessee given the play of Khalil Herbert. With the Bears having a Week 10 bye, I think Week 11 against Baltimore could be a good opportunity, unless they decide to wait until Week 12 for a favorable rushing matchup against Detroit. Given that Detroit is who he got hurt against though, I think we will see him Week 11.

On To Week Nine!

This Week’s Matchups

Team ACL Tear vs Team Ross: The top two seeds so far this season face off in what should be a fun one. Two electric QBs in Lamar and Kyler face off, although neither has been quite what their owners had probably fully hoped for when drafting them. While JL’s team has seemingly been getting weaker, at least in comparison to some budding super teams, there is a lot to like with Murray, Ekeler, Lamb, and emerging star Deebo Samuel. There is a reason this team is 8-0 after all, and it has been the consistency. While not always a lock for 120+ like MW in 2020, JL is gonna put up competitive numbers every week, and so far that has always been enough to win. For Aross, this team has certainly garnered a lot of criticism for being 5-3 despite a low PF. There are some key guys who have underperformed so far in Dalvin, AJB, and Keenan Allen, although the latter two showed signs of righting the ship last week. Without Antonio Brown, the FLEX position remains a major concern, as well as the inconsistent play of Miles Gaskin. It just simply isn’t good practice to pick against Jonah currently, so we like Team ACL Tear by 13.4 in a higher-scoring game than some may expect.

JL: “Excited to see who wins the ‘fraud bowl’ between Aross and I”

Alex: “JL is due. Simple as that. Good win tho Jonah”

Real Brothers vs Dmichs: These teams come in off very different week eight narratives, as Jart was blown out of the water and Dmichs was betrayed by Travis Kelce on MNF. Dmichs surely we will glad to have Hollywood and Jacobs back off bye to help round out a lineup that overall had a lower scoring week. Amari Cooper looked great with Cooper Rush at the helm, and should continue that into this week with Dak presumably back. Hollywood draws a nice matchup with a very suspect Minnesota secondary that was just torn up by the aforementioned Rush, while Kelce should bounce back nicely in a big time game. For Jart, the questions this week begin and end at the RB spot. With Swift on bye, Sanders on IR, and Saquon questionable, things could get dicey very quickly. While we know The Family trusts Kenyan Drake under new coaching, he is far from a sure thing. There is a lot to like of course from the WR trio of Chase, Adams, and Tyreek, while Hurts and Pitts should increase their production this week. While this is a tough one to predict, we expect Saquon to be able to give it a go, and that catalyzes a team with a lot of potential firepower. We like Real Brothers by 4.4 in a barn burner.

Dmichs: “Excited for my matchup with Jarrett, always a fun competitor”

Jart: “Excited for my matchup with Daniel, always a fun competitor. A lot to like about this Dmichs squad. Will be nice to get to see Damien Harris, Hollywood, Dallas Goedert and Bosh before the matchup and hear how they’ve been doing. All four were on The Family last year and we’re glad they’ve stuck together. We’ve got a lot of respect for Dak and JTay. We hope to put our best out there this week in a bounceback performance.”

GRIDDY GANG vs $94 for Dwilli REAALLY?: These are two teams headed in dramatically different directions. A team who two weeks ago was seen as the likely champion, poor performances and a likely fantasy-season-ending injury to Derrick Henry has left Jason in an extremely difficult situation, while despite some real dumb trades Nooni finds himself in the playoffs currently. We expect Jason to pursue a RB in free agency this week to replace Henry, and perhaps a QB as well. For Nooni, a bye week for Godwin, Evans, and LockettE has this team looking a little sus from top to bottom this week. Chuba Hubbard will likely slide into FLEX, but there is not a ton of firepower outside of hopeful performances from Hendoggy and Khalil Herbert. For Jason, Justin Jefferson simply has to get going soon, and a bye for Terry McLaurin offers Parker and Mooney a chance to step up. This one could go many different ways, but we expect some of Jason’s stars to pick it up this week, and though this one may be on the lower side of scoring, we like GRIDDY GANG by 7.8.

Jase: “Who am I even playing”

Trade King: “W”

United Nations vs Pray for Ridley: There’s a lot that could be said here, but I think this one boils down to the status of CMC. With Brady and Hockenson on bye, Bank likely won’t have the firepower to match a MW team with McCaffrey, even with the Cards stack. Aaron Jones and Robert Woods both have very nice matchups that should bolster the lineup as a whole, even if this writer does not have confidence in the longevity of the Cards RB stack. If McCaffrey and James Robinson both can’t go, an MW team that badly needs a win likely does not have much of a shot. Unfortunately, as of Tuesday night, neither seems particularly likely to play, and this we like Pray for Ridley by 11.2 in a very low scoring game.

MW: “Excited to finally get a win again and have my number 1 pick back”

Bank: “My matchup against Merrick sucks”

NN vs I Got a Half Chubb: I love this matchup. Stafford-Rodgers highlights what should be a fun one from top to bottom, as there are a good number of guys with some volatility in both of these lineups. For NN, Najee and Kupp have been the rocks, while the ascendance of Michael Carter and return of Clyde Edwards-Helaire will be interesting to watch. For CJ, the play of Michael Pittman Jr lately has certainly been eye-catching, while Melvin Gordon has continued to fill in admirably for RIP DMONT. Red hot Nath certainly has a lot going for him, and it’ll be tough to pick against a team that just led the league in PF this week. Aaron Rodgers should have a massive outing in a back and forth game with the Chiefs, while the Carter-Pittman Jr matchup on TNF brings some intriguing early action. With some room for waiver acquisitions, NN’s team could show us a new look by tomorrow, but we like its sure-thing firepower enough to feel safer picking them this week. We don’t like safe though! In one that could definitely go either way, we like CJ by 3.2, led by Rodgers and Andrews.

NN: “Good win to my opponent”

CJ: “I need to take down red hot Nath”

Mike Williams WR1 vs Team Horses: If you listen to Brad, he’s winning. And he may be right. Bye weeks for Metcalf, Fournette, Gibson, and McKissic take some stars out of this matchup, but there is still a lot to like out there. Josh Allen has proven his QB1 status from the offseason, while Tee Higgins, Jerry Jeudy, and Jaylen Waddle all provide big play opportunities. Ty Johnson is coming off a big game while the Jets figure out snap distribution at RB, and should see some additional opportunities in a quick week against the Colts. For Brad, the struggling Patrick Mahomes is joined by undrafted Elijah Mitchell and Cordarelle Patterson, who have both shown their ability to compete with the best of em. Few WR trios provide greater boom-bust production than BMW-Cooks-Juice, but all have at least decent matchups this week. People are talking, and they’re liking Brad. But let’s shut them up, Team Horses by 7.6.

Brad: “No idea who I’m playing, don’t matter, winning once again.”

Folbe: “People are talking. Let’s shut them up”

Best Player at Each Position

In this segment we will predict who will have the best fantasy performance this week at each position, along with who they are rostered by (if they are currently rostered).

QB: Aaron Rodgers, CJ

RB: Austin Ekeler, JL

WR: Cooper Kupp, NN

TE: Mark Andrews, CJ

D/ST: Saints D/ST, FA

K: Justin Tucker, FA

Family Award

This week, for the second time this season, the Family Award goes to Jonah Lopas for his pending adoption of Calvin Ridley. We hope he has found a good home.
